original_text: MINERAL (MINeral ERror AnaLysis) is a new MATLAB® based program that provides mineral formula recalculations combined with the associated propagation of the analytical uncertainties. Methods are based on the work of Giamarita and Day (1990). However, additional features have been added to provide users with greater flexibility in data reporting. Many programs exist to recalculate wt% data into formula unit cations. Some generalized programs can be used to recalculate the formula of multiple minerals e.g. CALCMIN (Brandelik, 2009) and HYPER-FORM (De Bjerg et al., 1992). Other programs are mineral specific e.g. AMPH CLASS (Esawi, 2004) and PROBE AMPH (Tindle and Webb, 1994) for the recalculation of amphibole analyses; ILMAT (Lepage, 2003) for the recalculation of magnetite and ilmenite; and PX-NOM (Sturm, 2002) for the recalculation of pyroxene analyses. MINERAL provides a rapid method for the recalculation of multiple common minerals. However, its strength lies in the fact that is the first tool to incorporate the associated uncertainty propagation calculations. As these are performed concurrently with the standard recalculations, no additional time is needed to perform uncertainty propagation. While an understanding of the underlying calculations is strongly recommended, MINERAL is designed to allow users with little or no experience operating MATLAB® and/or performing mineral formula recalculations and uncertainty propagation to undertake both with ease.
original_translation: MINERAL (MINeral ERror AnaLysis) es un nuevo programa basado en MATLAB® que proporciona recalculos de fórmulas minerales combinados con la propagación asociada de las incertidumbres analíticas. Los métodos se basan en el trabajo de Giamarita y Day (1990). Sin embargo, se han añadido características adicionales para brindar a los usuarios una mayor flexibilidad en la generación de informes de datos. Existen muchos programas para recalcular los datos de porcentaje en peso en cationes de unidades de fórmula. Algunos programas generalizados se pueden utilizar para recalcular la fórmula de múltiples minerales, por ejemplo. CALCMIN (Brandelik, 2009) y HYPER-FORM (De Bjerg et al., 1992). Otros programas son específicos para minerales, por ejemplo. AMPH CLASS (Esawi, 2004) y PROBE AMPH (Tindle y Webb, 1994) para el recalculo de análisis de anfíboles; ILMAT (Lepage, 2003) para el recalculo de magnetita e ilmenita; y PX-NOM (Sturm, 2002) para el recalculo de análisis de piroxenos. MINERAL proporciona un método rápido para el recálculo de múltiples minerales comunes. Sin embargo, su fortaleza radica en el hecho de que es la primera herramienta en incorporar los cálculos de propagación de incertidumbre asociados. Dado que estos se realizan simultáneamente con las recálculos estándar, no se necesita tiempo adicional para realizar la propagación de incertidumbre. Si bien se recomienda encarecidamente tener un entendimiento de los cálculos subyacentes, MINERAL está diseñado para permitir que los usuarios con poca o ninguna experiencia en el manejo de MATLAB® y/o en la realización de recalculos de fórmulas minerales y propagación de incertidumbres puedan llevar a cabo ambas tareas con facilidad.

MINERAL (MINeral ERror AnaLysis) es un nuevo programa basado en MATLAB® que proporciona recalculos de fórmulas minerales combinados con la propagación asociada de las incertidumbres analíticas. Los métodos se basan en el trabajo de Giamarita y Day (1990). Sin embargo, se han añadido características adicionales para brindar a los usuarios una mayor flexibilidad en la generación de informes de datos. Existen muchos programas para recalcular los datos de porcentaje en peso en cationes de unidades de fórmula. Algunos programas generalizados se pueden utilizar para recalcular la fórmula de múltiples minerales, por ejemplo. CALCMIN (Brandelik, 2009) y HYPER-FORM (De Bjerg et al., 1992). Otros programas son específicos para minerales, por ejemplo. AMPH CLASS (Esawi, 2004) y PROBE AMPH (Tindle y Webb, 1994) para el recalculo de análisis de anfíboles; ILMAT (Lepage, 2003) para el recalculo de magnetita e ilmenita; y PX-NOM (Sturm, 2002) para el recalculo de análisis de piroxenos. MINERAL proporciona un método rápido para el recálculo de múltiples minerales comunes. Output: Sin embargo, su fortaleza radica en el hecho de que es la primera herramienta en
incorporar los cálculos de propagación de incertidumbre asociados.
Dado que estos se realizan simultáneamente con las recálculos estándar, no se necesita tiempo adicional para realizar la propagación de incertidumbre. Si bien se recomienda encarecidamente tener un entendimiento de los cálculos subyacentes, MINERAL está diseñado para permitir que los usuarios con poca o ninguna experiencia en el manejo de MATLAB® y/o en la realización de recalculos de fórmulas minerales y propagación de incertidumbres puedan llevar a cabo ambas tareas con facilidad.

original_annotated_sentences: MINERAL (MINeral ERror AnaLysis) is a new MATLAB® based program that provides mineral formula recalculations combined with the associated propagation of the analytical uncertainties.

Methods
are based on the work of Giamarita and Day (1990).
However, additional features have been added to provide users with greater flexibility in data reporting.
Many programs exist to recalculate wt% data into formula unit cations.
Some generalized programs can be used to recalculate the formula of multiple minerals e.g.
CALCMIN (Brandelik, 2009) and HYPER-FORM (De Bjerg et al., 1992).
Other programs are mineral specific e.g.

AMPH CLASS (Esawi, 2004) and PROBE AMPH (Tindle and Webb, 1994) for the recalculation of amphibole analyses; ILMAT (Lepage, 2003) for the recalculation of magnetite and ilmenite; and PX-NOM (Sturm, 2002) for the recalculation of pyroxene analyses.
MINERAL provides a rapid method for the recalculation of multiple common minerals.
However, its strength lies in the fact that is the first tool to incorporate the associated uncertainty propagation calculations.
As these are performed concurrently with the standard recalculations, no additional time is needed to perform uncertainty propagation.

While an understanding of the underlying calculations is strongly recommended, MINERAL is designed to allow users with little or no experience operating MATLAB® and/or performing mineral formula recalculations and uncertainty propagation to undertake both with ease.

MINERAL provides a rapid method for the recalculation of multiple common minerals.
However, its strength lies in the fact that is the first tool to incorporate the associated uncertainty propagation calculations.

While an understanding of the underlying calculations is strongly recommended, MINERAL is designed to allow users with little or no experience operating MATLAB® and/or performing mineral formula recalculations and uncertainty propagation to undertake both with ease.

original_annotated_sentences: MINERAL (MINeral ERror AnaLysis) is a new MATLAB® based program that provides mineral formula recalculations combined with the associated propagation of the analytical uncertainties.
Methods are based on the work of Giamarita and Day (1990).
However, additional features have been added to provide users with greater flexibility in data reporting.
Many programs exist to recalculate wt% data into formula unit cations.
Some generalized programs can be used to recalculate the formula of multiple minerals e.g.
CALCMIN (Brandelik, 2009) and HYPER-FORM (De Bjerg et al., 1992).
Other programs are mineral specific e.g.

AMPH CLASS (Esawi, 2004) and PROBE AMPH (Tindle and Webb, 1994) for the
recalculation of amphibole analyses
; ILMAT (Lepage, 2003) for the recalculation of magnetite and ilmenite; and PX-NOM (Sturm, 2002) for the recalculation of pyroxene analyses.
MINERAL provides a rapid method for the recalculation of multiple common minerals.
However, its strength lies in the fact that is the first tool to incorporate the associated uncertainty propagation calculations.
As these are performed concurrently with the standard recalculations, no additional time is needed to perform uncertainty propagation.

While an understanding of the underlying calculations is strongly recommended, MINERAL is designed to allow users with little or no experience operating MATLAB® and/or performing mineral formula recalculations and uncertainty propagation to undertake both with ease.
